com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api

Interface DataChannel


  • public interface DataChannel
    Interface that transfers data between the conductor node and the player nodes.

    Note: The Java Integration stage only supports data transfer from the conductor node to the player nodes. In the Java code, complete the following steps:

    • Ensure that NODE_PLAYER is specified as the destination argument of the sendTo(int, Serializable) method.
    • Ensure that NODE_CONDUCTOR is specified as the source argument of the receiveFrom(int) method.
    Version:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Configuration.getDataChannel()

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NODE_CONDUCTOR
      Constant that identifies the conductor node.
      static int NODE_PLAYER
      Constant that identifies the player node.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Serializable receiveFrom(int source)
      Receives an object sent from the specified node.
      void sendTo(int destination, Serializable obj)
      Sends an object to the specified nodes.

    • Field Detail

      • NODE_CONDUCTOR

        static final int NODE_CONDUCTOR
        Constant that identifies the conductor node.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NODE_PLAYER

        static final int NODE_PLAYER
        Constant that identifies the player node.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • receiveFrom

        Serializable receiveFrom(int source)
        Receives an object sent from the specified node.
        Note: The Java Integration stage only supports data transfer from the conductor node to the player nodes.
        Parameters:
        source - The identifier of the source node.
        Returns:
        An object passed through the data transfer service.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - is thrown if any supported operation is requested. This exception is thrown if NODE_CONDUCTOR is not specified as the source argument or if the receiveFrom(int) method is called on the conductor node.

      • sendTo

        void sendTo(int destination,
          Serializable obj)
        Sends an object to the specified nodes.
        Note: The Java Integration stage only supports data transfer from the conductor node to the player nodes.
        Parameters:
        destination - The identifier of the destination node.
        obj - The object that is sent to the specified nodes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if a given object is null.
        UnsupportedOperationException - is thrown if any supported operation is requested. This exception is thrown if NODE_PLAYER is not specified as the destination argument or if the sendTo(int, Serializable) method is called on the player node.
        IllegalStateException - is thrown if it is called at the illegal state.
        Note: In the current release, it is thrown if it is called from the Processor.terminate(boolean) method.
